Elecciones generales: El debate de portavoces se tensa con Cataluña y los posibles pactos
Lastra, Álvarez de Toledo, Arrimadas, Montero, Espinosa, Rufián y Esteban confrontan hoy sus ideas
01 Nov 2019, 20:03 by ep
Las portavoces parlamentarias del PP y Ciudadanos, Cayetana Álvarez de Toledo e Inés Arrimadas, han exigido a su homóloga del PSOE, Adriana Lastra, que enumere cuántas naciones entienden los socialistas que hay en España, a lo que Lastra ha respondido reivindicado el artículo dos de la Constitución, que señala que el país lo forman regiones y nacionalidades.



Esta ha sido una de las cuestiones que han destacado en la primera parte del debate celebrado en RTVE este viernes de arranque de la campaña electoral, en el que han participado los portavoces en el Congreso de PSOE, PP, Cs, Unidas Podemos, Vox, ERC y el PNV.
El primer bloque estaba dedicado a la política territorial, pero se ha discutido únicamente sobre Cataluña. Arrimadas ha sido la primera en reclamar a Lastra que explicara a cámara qué es la plurinacionalidad que defiende el PSOE, a la que alude en su programa electoral para el 10N, y en cuántas naciones se traduce. La portavoz ha dicho que si ERC y el PNV quieren que Pedro Sánchez vuelva a ser presidente es porque es "un chollo para el separatismo" y motivo para no votarle, a su juicio.
Álvarez de Toledo ha reclamado lo mismo a la portavoz socialista y ha advertido de que con el PSOE no se logrará lo que el PP pretende: que el independentismo desista y vaya "al rincón de pensar" una temporada. "El gran problema de España es el PSOE, que rompe la igualdad entre españoles, una bandera de la izquierda", ha dicho. "Tenemos dos opciones (ante Cataluña) - : firmeza constitucional o la vía socialista", ha agregado.
Adriana Lastra ha rechazado que se cuestione la defensa de la Constitución por el PSOE. Entre constantes interrupciones de las portavoces de PP y Cs para que dijera cuántas naciones hay en España, no ha respondido a esta cuestión y ha reivindicado el artículo 2 de la Carta Magna, que señala que en el país hay regiones y nacionalidades. "Es su estrategia -les ha replicado a sus contrincantes-, estamos acostumbrados a que no dejen hablar".
Quien sí ha respondido ha sido el portavoz del PNV, Aitor Esteban, para quien es claro que el País Vasco y Cataluña son dos naciones diferentes de España y el de ERC, Gabriel Rufián, ha animado a Lastra a "no tener complejo de reconocer que España es un país de países".
Por parte de Vox, Iván Espinosa de los Monteros ha pedido medidas excepcionales para parar el "golpe de Estado en sesión continua" que a su juicio se está dando en Cataluña y por Unidas Podemos, Irene Montero ha pedido diálogo, acuerdo y alguna fórmula legal que permita consultar a los ciudadanos.
Esta portavoz y Aitor Esteban han sido los únicos que han hablado de otros temas distintos de Cataluña. Montero ha reclamado medidas contra la despoblación y la España rural.

General elections: The spokespersons debate is tense with Catalonia and the possible pacts
Lastra, Álvarez de Toledo, Arrimadas, Montero, Espinosa, Rufián and Esteban today confront their ideas
01 Nov 2019, 20:03 by ep
The parliamentary spokesmen of the PP and Citizens, Cayetana Álvarez de Toledo and Inés Arrimadas, have demanded their counterpart from the PSOE, Adriana Lastra, to list how many nations understand the socialists in Spain, to which Lastra has responded vindicated article two of the Constitution, which indicates that the country is made up of regions and nationalities.



This has been one of the issues that have been highlighted in the first part of the debate held at RTVE this Friday of the start of the electoral campaign, in which the spokesmen participated in the Congress of PSOE, PP, Cs, United We Can, Vox, ERC and the PNV.
The first block was dedicated to territorial policy, but only Catalonia has been discussed. Arrimadas was the first to claim Lastra to explain to the camera what is the plurinationality defended by the PSOE, which alludes to in its electoral program for 10N, and how many nations it translates. The spokeswoman has said that if ERC and the PNV want Pedro Sánchez to be president again it is because he is "a bargain for separatism" and reason not to vote for him, in her opinion.
Álvarez de Toledo has claimed the same thing from the socialist spokeswoman and warned that the PSOE will not achieve what the PP intends: that independence will desist and go "to the corner of thinking" one season. "The big problem in Spain is the PSOE, which breaks equality between Spaniards, a flag on the left," he said. "We have two options (before Catalonia) -: constitutional firmness or the socialist path," he added.
Adriana Lastra has refused to question the defense of the Constitution by the PSOE. Between constant interruptions of the spokesmen of PP and Cs so that it said how many nations there are in Spain, it has not responded to this question and has claimed article 2 of the Magna Carta, which indicates that in the country there are regions and nationalities. "It is his strategy - he has replied to his opponents - we are used to not stop talking."
Who has responded has been the spokesman of the PNV, Aitor Esteban, for whom it is clear that the Basque Country and Catalonia are two different nations of Spain and that of ERC, Gabriel Rufián, has encouraged Lastra to "have no complex to recognize that Spain is a country of countries. "
On behalf of Vox, Iván Espinosa de los Monteros has called for exceptional measures to stop the "coup d'etat in continuous session" that in his opinion is taking place in Catalonia and by United We Can, Irene Montero has asked for dialogue, agreement and some legal formula that allows citizens to consult.
This spokeswoman and Aitor Esteban have been the only ones who have talked about topics other than Catalonia. Montero has called for measures against depopulation and rural Spain.
